intro: Corynopuntia dumetorum, commonly known as the desert hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, mat-forming cactus with dense clusters of spiny stems that help reduce water loss and provide shelter for small animals. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are pollinated by various insects. Its succulent stems store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Corynopuntia dumetorum plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing food and habitat for desert wildlife.
